Auction Employment Agreements with Condition Precedents Cc PST The following email is to confirm my understanding of the following verbal assurances provided to me as part of the intent and conditions for signing a contingent employment agreementretention package related to the sale of the Enron gas and power trading business Enron trading business to a new entity If a new entity purchases the Enron trading business and the contingent employment agreement executed on January becomes a valid and binding agreement Enrons management will not initiate a lawsuit to recover the performance bonus payments Enron andor purchaser of the Enron trading business will seek approval from the bankruptcy judge of the performance bonus payments to eliminate any future uncertainty with respect to the validity of those payments To the extent the total retention s available for the Enron trading business employees is increased above current levels from the leading bidder as of January the intent of Enrons senior management is to make an upward adjustment to the individual employees who have committed to the new entity such that the employee maintains a substantially similar percentage of the total pool of retention s

RE Update following our meeting re VEPCO Cc The LD calc should be the hourly index and we need to eliminate the Peak Day designation damages Original Message From Sager Elizabeth Sent Tuesday November AM To Jafry Rahil Presto Kevin M Duran W David Kroll Heather Cc Thomas Paul D Subject RE Update following our meeting re VEPCO CONFIDENTIAL ATTORNEYCLIENT PRIVILEGED COMMUNICATION On the VEPCO contract we also need to consider the damages for failure to deliver scheduled energy Yesterday we talked about normal LDs This likely will not work if we are basing the VEPCO price on an hourly index since VEPCOs cost of cover would likely be close to hourly prices Under the current contract if we fail to deliver EPMI is obligated to pay Cost of Cover defined as either a actual cost of incremental purchase or generation costs or if VEPCO is unable to make up the delivery obligations then VEPCOs highest cost source of generation minus b offered energy price hourly index price under new proposal Section plus either A If VEPCO has designated day as a Peak Day up to per year then rebate a portion of annual capacity payments I think current amount would be about per nondelivery if no MW delivered during day Section or B If VEPCO has not designated day as a Peak Day up to per year then rebate a portion of daily capacity payments I think current amount would be about per nondelivery if no MW delivered during day Section Lets think about what we should propose eg of index hourly price per hour of nondelivery Thanks Elizabeth Sager Original Message From Jafry Rahil Sent Monday November PM To Presto Kevin M Duran W David Sager Elizabeth Kroll Heather Cc Thomas Paul D Subject Update following our meeting re VEPCO Importance High Everyone Here are some followup items from our meeting this morning Please review them and let me know if there are any changes to this at your earliest As discussed we will tiein Dave and Elizabeth into the meeting via phone it starts at c AM CST Leslie Reeves has confirmed that we do not have any reserves against previous years audit Attending the meeting from VEPCO Kevin Howell President Energy Trading Kevin was at Duke prior to VEPCO started with VEPCO on Karla Haislip Head of Origination John Mable Origination Jim Hayes Trading Goal ENE will aim to settle against the RealTime hourly index published by the PJM ISO for VEPCOPotomac interface MWh for delivery ENE will retain the option to deliver the physical energy at any point identified in the contract The legal definition of the settlement index has been reviewed by Paul Thomas in Kevins group and will be as follows The Floating Price during a Determination Period shall be the average of the hourly prices listed in the Index for electricity delivered at the during the applicable hours on each Delivery Day during the applicable Determination Period The Floating Price for each Determination Period shall be calculated utilizing the hourly clearing prices published by PJM Interconnection LLC for the VEPCO Interface VAP on its official web site currently located at wwwpjmcompubaccountlmpindexhtml or any successor thereto under the headings PJM Daily RealTime Locational Marginal Pricing Files VAP the Index The price is quoted in US Dollars per unit of volume which will be the Contractual Currency The unit of measure against which the price is quoted shall be megawatthours MWh and the quantity shown shall be in MWs delivered in each applicable hour for the duration of the Transaction the Hourly Quantity

RE Curves and Correlations Cc PST Casey has a list of all the East Power curves Frank Stop reinventing the wheel This stuff has been done already Original Message From Hayden Frank Sent Friday February PM To Presto Kevin M Belden Tim Zufferli John Lavorato John Cc White Stacey W Gossett Jeffrey C Gorny Vladimir Whalley Greg Subject Curves and Correlations I have to clean up clustering and curve mappings from Estate to NETCO Last correlation update was Nov th and Im assuming we may have some issues The curves we are rolling into NETCO need to be highly accurate for the last days to ensure variance covariance matrix is appropriate Please provide me list of curves we are using in NETCO Identify which curves should be primary and which curves can be secondary Additionally please identify if there are any regional constraints that need to be locked in between primary and secondary curves I will then rerun correlations so we can properly understand diversification benefit across wholesale as it relates to proposed VAR limit structures Thanks Frank
